coref: An Ox came down to a reedy pool to drink. As An Ox splashed heavily into the water, An Ox crushed a young Frog into the mud. a young Frog soon missed the little one and asked An Ox brothers and sisters what had become of An Ox. A great big monster, said one of his brothers and sisters, stepped on little brother with one of An Ox huge feet! Big, was An Ox! said the old Frog, puffing herself up. Was An Ox as big as this? Oh, much bigger! they cried. a young Frog puffed up still more. a young Frog could not have been bigger than this, herself said. But the little Frogs all declared that the monster was much, much bigger and a young Frog a young Frog kept puffing herself out more and more until, all at once, herself burst.
